page.title: 02River Cray Area
page.content: This block covers the area of the {River Cray}from Foots Cray High St. to the Five Arches bridge. The study area is towards the eastern edge of Sidcup. It appears to be the largest single stretch of open land in the immediate vicinity of Sidcup. The area is primarily meadowland and is dissected by the{River Cray}. There is a network of footpaths criss-crossing the area. On the eastern side of the river there is a council housing estate, along with a few factories towards the southern end of the section. It is a very picturesque setting especially along the western side of the River Cray around Five Arches. It is a very popular place for walks, picnics and general recreation.
